reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Hotel in between Christmas and New Year. The Hotel is in a Great Location and the entrance is very Grand but there was a huge line at check-in when we arrived having to wait some 35 minutes before getting to the front of the line. We were greated courteously by the staff at check-in but it was obvious there had been a problem with Housekeeping as many of the rooms were not ready and this was the cause for the delay and our greeting was less genuine than it could have been.
reviews.title: Hilton De Soto - Savannah

reviews.text: My expectations from this Hilton were very high but alas I was very disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent location and excellent staff.

reviews.text: Whilst I understand there has to be a balance between a contemporary feel and keeping a historic theme in line with the surroundings, to me the rooms seemed to be a little on the tired side.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The windows seemed not to close properly and rattled with the slightest breeze keeping me awake most of the 2 nights we were there and the bathroom tiles had dark brown marks in the tiling grout which was very unsightly and left you wondering how clean the bathroom really was.
reviews.title: Great location - expectations were higher

reviews.text: I know it's not the fault of the Hotel but is worth a mention; it's located amongst many Churches and every hour on the hour during daylight they all seem to have a face off to see who can have the most elaberate and noisiest church bell ring!!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the middle of all of the historic area. Short walk from everything. Nice hotel but because it is historic area, the building is a little dated. Not bad but a crack here and there. If you can get a good price on travel sites (I did- $95 a night) this is worth being in the heart of historic area.
reviews.title: Good hotel with GREAT location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say my spouse and I were a little worried after we won a priceline bid and this was the hotel we got. Reading those negative reviews made us think we were staying at a overpriced days inn. To our surprise, it was a wonderful from the customer service to the room everything was a pleasant experience. I have to say like other hotels, walls are thin so u do have some noise and it is best to stay in a room far from the elevators.
reviews.title: Surprised

reviews.text: I would recommend to try dinner Cha Bellas and for Breakfast J.Christophers
reviews.title: Not up to Hilton Standards

reviews.text: We stayed here in November on points. We have stayed at many Hilton properties all over the world and this property is not up to the standards of other Hilton properties. The restaurant was particularly disappointing, not so much for the food choices but for the uncleanliness of the dishes. At breakfast on 2 different occasions, the place settings and coffee cups were dirty with rings, stains and dried on food. Very unappetizing way to start the day. The rooms did not have as thorough of a cleaning as one expects from Hilton. I would not choose to stay at this property again.
reviews.title: Hilton Desoto Very Good Downtown Location

reviews.text: Rooms were nice and clean a little old building. Staff was very nice and location is the best if you want to stay in downtown. couple of blocks to river and bay street but in heart of Downtown Savannah.
reviews.title: Savannah Redone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent 3 wonderful January days in Savannah and had the joys and comforts of the De Soto as my rest stop. Attending a conference, the facilities were superior. At times the AC to efficient but not as a detriment. Conference rooms clean and neat. Fully staffed snack and meal service was appreciated. Trash collection and food service items quickly and smoothly removed. Quality of food and buffet services exceptional!
reviews.title: Hilton De Soto

reviews.text: Front desk personnel warm and efficient. Ready and able to assist!
reviews.title: A nice property in a great location

reviews.text: Parking garage clean and safe. Well lighted with 24-hour personnel coverage.
reviews.title: Great common spaces and service, room needed some work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Within easy walking distance to the river and fine dining. Dare you to find a bad meal! Drinks while over looking the river bring a sense of peace and place. Ships sail in and out - be amazed.
reviews.title: A average Hilton with superb location and staff

reviews.text: Take some time and enjoy the historic district and art. The parks and open areas are an example for every city in U.S. to try and duplicate.
reviews.title: Nice location, comfortable rooms but a bit noisy

reviews.text: My reviews of hotels are usually quite complimentary because I use other Tripadvisor reviews to help me choose, and the reviews have not steered me wrong. However, we were in Savannah for a conference--which chose this hotel for us. We didn't have a bad stay at this hotel; we are just used to better accommodations.
reviews.title: a disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, I want to compliment the staff. Everyone was quite friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out were quick and efficient. Also, the lobby is lovely, as are the bar and restaurant.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: We upgraded our room to a corner room with a view. Though we had requested a high floor, we were placed on the 6th. The hotel, I think, was full. The room was large and did have a view with balcony; however, the furnishings were dated, the walls (stippled) were painted a light institutional green, and the pictures on the walls were small, seemed randomly chosen and placed and added nothing to the ambiance of the room. The bed skirt was not on the bed straight and was stained in several places. There was an extra vanity in the room--which was nice to have--and shelving holding a coffee maker. This part of the room, however nice it was to have, seemed to be very cheaply built. It definitely went along with the walls and strange choice of pictures. The bathroom was O.K. but the baseboards needed a thorough dusting. The TV was nice, but it was placed on a really small chest that seemed out of place in the large room. In other words, the decor of the room itself didn't seem as though it belonged in a Hilton Hotel. We were disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, we had only one bar of soap (no shower gel at all the whole time we were there) and no bath mat. We also had no duvet on the bed. After notifying the desk, these matters were taken care of cheerfully. There were no bath robes, either. I can't remember the last time we were in a major hotel that didn't furnish at least one robe. When we inquired about that, we were told that the hotel no longer put robes in rooms.
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area around the hotel was nice, but we would have preferred to be closer to the river.
reviews.title: So far no that Happy
